vulnerability_findings.name: arbitrary-send
vulnerability_findings.message:
EtherGet.withdrawEther (0x52d2e0f9b01101a59b38a3d05c80b7618aeed984.sol#21-23) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- owner.transfer(this.balance) (0x52d2e0f9b01101a59b38a3d05c80b7618aeed984.sol#22)

vulnerability_findings.name: arbitrary-send
vulnerability_findings.message:
EtherGet.getTokens (0x52d2e0f9b01101a59b38a3d05c80b7618aeed984.sol#25-29) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- addr.call.value(0)() (0x52d2e0f9b01101a59b38a3d05c80b7618aeed984.sol#27)

vulnerability_findings.name: unused-return
vulnerability_findings.message:
EtherGet.withdrawTokens (0x52d2e0f9b01101a59b38a3d05c80b7618aeed984.sol#16-19) does not use the value returned by external calls:
	-tc.transfer(owner,tc.balanceOf(this)) (0x52d2e0f9b01101a59b38a3d05c80b7618aeed984.sol#18)

vulnerability_findings.name: calls-loop
vulnerability_findings.message:
EtherGet.getTokens has external calls inside a loop:
	- addr.call.value(0)() (0x52d2e0f9b01101a59b38a3d05c80b7618aeed984.sol#27)

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
external-function
solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in 0x52d2e0f9b01101a59b38a3d05c80b7618aeed984.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.19 (0x52d2e0f9b01101a59b38a3d05c80b7618aeed984.sol#1): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
External Call To User-Supplied Address (SWC 107)
vulnerability_findings.message:
A call to a user-supplied address is executed.
An external message call to an address specified by the caller is executed. Note that the callee account might contain arbitrary code and could re-enter any function within this contract. Reentering the contract in an intermediate state may lead to unexpected behaviour. Make sure that no state modifications are executed after this call and/or reentrancy guards are in place.
Classification: SWC-107

vulnerability_findings.name: Multiple Calls in a Single Transaction (SWC 113)
vulnerability_findings.message:
Multiple calls are executed in the same transaction.
This call is executed following another call within the same transaction. It is possible that the call never gets executed if a prior call fails permanently. This might be caused intentionally by a malicious callee. If possible, refactor the code such that each transaction only executes one external call or make sure that all callees can be trusted (i.e. they’re part of your own codebase).
Classification: SWC-113

vulnerability_findings.name: Unchecked return value from external call. (SWC 104)
vulnerability_findings.message:
The return value of a message call is not checked.
External calls return a boolean value. If the callee halts with an exception, 'false' is returned and execution continues in the caller. The caller should check whether an exception happened and react accordingly to avoid unexpected behavior. For example it is often desirable to wrap external calls in require() so the transaction is reverted if the call fails.
Classification: SWC-104

vulnerability_findings.name: External Call To User-Supplied Address (SWC 107)
